intro: Luzama chaucana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Luzama chaucana is often found in the Andes Mountains, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
